intro: Lastrea pallescens, commonly known as the pale lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in dry, sunny environments. Its leaves are usually grayish-green and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are small and yellowish-white. Lastrea pallescens is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
